gurmukhi: eyk smY hm ko suin ko suin aUDv kuMjn mY iPrY sMg lIXy ] hir jU Aiq hI iqh swQ Gny hm pY Aiq hI khXo pRym kIXy ]
transliteration: Ek Samai Ham Ko Soun(i) Oodhav Kounjan Mai Phirai San Leeye|| Har(i) Joo At(i) Hitih Saath Ghane Ham Pai At(i) Hikahyo Prem Keeye||
translation: “O Udhava ! there was a time when Krishna used to take us alongwith him and roamed in the alvoces; he gave profound love to us;

gurmukhi: iqn ky bis gXo hmro mn hÍY Aiq hI suKu BXo biRj nwr hIXo ] Ab so qij kY mQurw ko gXo ihq ky ibCury Pl kaun jIXy ]927]
transliteration: Tin Ke Bas(i) Gyo Hamro Man Hvai At(i) Soukh(u) Bhyo Brij Naar Heeye|| Ab So Taj(i) Kai Mathuraa Ko Gado Hit Ke Bichure Phal Kaoun Jeeye||927||
translation: “Our mind was under the control of that Krishna and all the women of Braja were in extreme comfort; now the same Krishna has abandoned us and gone to Matura; how can we survive without that Krishna?”927.

gurmukhi: gÍwrin pY ijqnI Pun aUDv sXwm khY hir bwq bKwnI ] gXwn kO au`qr dyq BeI nih pRym icqwr sBy aucrwnI ]
transliteration: Gvaaran(i) Pai Jitniphoun Oodhav Syaam Kahai Har(i) Baat Bakhaanee|| Gyaan Kau Outtar Det Bhainah(i) Prem Chitaar Sabhe Ouchraanee||
translation: Udhava talked to the gopis all the things about Krishna; they did not say anything in respone to his words of wisdom and only uttered their language of love:

gurmukhi: jwhI ky dyKq Bojn Kwq sKI ijh ky ibn pIq n pwnI ] gXwn kI jo ien bwq khI iqnhUM ihq so kir eyk n mwnI ]928]
transliteration: Jaahike Dekhat Bhojan Khaat Sakhijih Ke Bin Peet Na Paanee|| Gyaan Kijo In Baat Kahitidhoondhit So Kar(i) Ek Na Maanee||928||
translation: Krishna, seeing whom, they used to take their meals and did not even drink water without him, whatever Udhava said to them about him in his wisdom, the gopis did not accept anything.928.
Speech of the gopis addressed to Udhava:

gurmukhi: iml kY iqn aUDv sMg khXo hir so sun aUDv XO khIXo ] kih kY kir aUDv gXwn ijqo piTXo iqqno sB hI ghIXo ]
transliteration: Mil Kai Tin Oodhav San Kahyo Har(i) So Soun Oodhav Yooun Kaheeyo|| Kah(i) Kai Kar(i) Oodhav Gyaan Jito Pathiyo Titno Sabh Higadeeyo||
translation: All of them collectively said to Udhava, “O Udhava ! you may talk to Krishna like this that all the words of wisdom that he had sent through you, have been imbibed by us;

gurmukhi: sB hI ien gÍwrin pY kib sXwm khXo ihq AwKn so chIXo ] ienko qum qXwg gey mQurw hmrI suD lyq sdw rhIXo ]929]
transliteration: Sabh Hiin Gvaaran(i) Pai Kabbi Syaam Kahyo Hit Aakhanndso Chaheeyo|| Inko Toum Tyaag Gad Mathuraa Hamrisudh Let Sadaa Raheeyo||929||
translation: “O Udhava ! taking into consideration our welfare, tell it definitely to Krishna that forsaking us he had gone to Matura, but there also he should keep in touch with us.”929.

gurmukhi: jb aUDv so ieh BwNq khXo qb aUDv ko mn pRym BrXo hY ] Aaur geI suD BUl sBY mn qy sB gXwn huqo su trXo hY ]
transliteration: Jah Oodhav So Eh Bhaant Kahyo Tab Oodhav Ko Man Prem Bdaryo Hai|| Aur Gadsudh Bhool Sabhai Man Te Sabh Gyaan Houto Su Daryo Hai||
translation: When gopis said all this to Udhava, he was then also filled with love; he lost his consciousness and the brilliance of wisdom ended in his mind;

gurmukhi: so imil kY sMg gÍwrn ky Aiq pRIq kI bwq ky sMg FrXo hY ] gXwn ky fwr mno kpry ihq kI srqw mih kUd prXo hY ]930]
transliteration: So Mil(i )kai San Gvaaran Ke At(i) Preet Kibaat Ke San Ddaryo Hai|| Gyaan Ke Daar Mano Kapre Hit Kisartaa Maih Kood Daryo Hai||930||
translation: He also began to talk about love in the company of gopis and it appeared that he had put off the clothes of wisdom and had plunged into the stream of love.930.

gurmukhi: Xo kih sMg guAwrn ky jbhI sB gÍwrin ko ihq cIno ] aUDv gXwn dXo qij kY mn mY jb pRym ko sMgH kIno ]
transliteration: Yo Kah(i) San Guaaran Ke Jab-hisabh Gvaaran(i) Ko Hit Cheeno|| Oodhav Gyaan Dayo Taj(i) Kai Man Mai Jab Prem Ko Sanrah Keeno||
translation: When Udhava recognised the love of gopis, he also began to converse with the gopis about love; Udhava gathered love in his mind and abandoned his wisdom;
